intro: Viola tricolor var. parvula, commonly known as the small-flowered viola, is a compact perennial species native to Europe. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of trifoliate flowers in shades of violet, white, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize readily. The species is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine.
